Review.Titre: Mixed feeling: Good product, BUT some flaws.
Review.Contenu: Istripper is a nice product. There are really many many very attractive ladies (+5000 I think, with different resolutions from 480p to 4K), and for all tastes. The models are most of the time crème-de-la-crème.If I stop here, it is 5/5.But I reduced my current score by 3 points:-1: Lately, they produced and sold – or about to release - rather many cards with a lower than expected resolution quality because of production problems: the 4K looking like a 3K and in some cards almost 1K. And it is not the first time (3rd time when I look at my +1700 cards in my collection). The problem is that they keep charging full price, with a lower quality product. When you know that you have to pay extra for getting this extra 4K resolution quality (called “Premium”), you feel uncomfortable with their commercial practice.-0.5: because they have problem understanding and listening to clients. Some “moderators” are perfectly ethical, but some others in forum are very eager to censor any “dissident” and react really abusively. They are even more vocal than the istripper staff ("plus Royaliste que le Roi") Very Russian style sometimes: not neutral in behavior, deciding without quoting any rule, they behave like fan-boys and lack a neutral ethic and clear acting rules.-0.5 : the internal QA does not exist. Quality control is done externally by clients/moderators, often on very short notice from istripper, and they are simply unpaid volunteers and long-time clients. It was probably ok before, but this unprofessional quality control shows its limit, especially now that istripper ventures into the NFT world and their small team is under extreme work load and pressure.-1 : because I registered with istripper using a private email address. But I receive emails from istripper and this trustpilot site using my official email shared by other persons. Very unwelcome and so much for privacy!... ALL communication should have gone to the registered email box associated with my istripper account, or at least use the name "Totem" (the company), rather than the product name. Breach of trust.

Occasionally has good content, but it's fallen a long way for what it is. Used to be it was just pretty girls, dancing. Now it's a softcore experience with dildos and whathaveyou- that's something you can get ~anywhere~, whereas the previous options were more unique. Outfits are really hit or miss, mostly miss, as are the girls, and so few can actually dance. It's become a glorified cam show at times. For a while this was separated, with Deskbabes, but now it's literally the majority of the content.None of this means you won't like the content- you might. For me, it's gone from mostly hit, to mostly miss. They do have some interesting "auctions" and "contests" for one of a kind memorabilia, if you happen to have Elon Musk money. Those "auctions" used to be more accessible, less costly, and the same could be said for the contests with their "fan signs" where a fan would win a unique picture.They've added VR content, which is kind of cool if you happen to have the ability to view it, and are willing to go spend more for that.The real issue is that they're so bad at producing content they've moved to using gimmicks they never would have years ago- unique shows that can only be gotten by gambling, for instances. Removing subscriptions for cards, instead you have to still buy the cards, but must subscribe in order to view them in 4k after you've already purchased them. New NFT content. I'm sure it pays well, because it preys upon collectors, and on men and women who have collection or even just buying impulses- often known as Whales in online transactions like this. I really hope the company moves back to where it was years ago, because I used to consider them pretty stand up, with good content. You don't need gimmicks, gambling, and feeding on people's psychological shortcomings. Just make good content and have reasonable prices and policies, or in time, you'll lose a lot of brand loyalty.
